page.title: 05LINTON MANOR HOUSE
page.content: Linton Manor is named in the original Domesday Book.It is said to be haunted by Dorothy De Bath.Her blood stain marks the kitchen floor after she was murdered by her lover.Her restless spirit now haunts the manor drive and spinney on a moonlight night.It takes a brave man to walk past the manor at night.The manor has twelve big rooms two very big attics.Part of the building is understood to be Elizabethan.In 1910 Mr.John Beard brought the manor and enlarged it.About that time John Beard owned part of Linton and Gresley and he owned the brewery known as Beard and Hill.The present owner is Mr.Julian Whittaker.
